what: Client Package for the U.S. Federal Register API
title: Client Package for the U.S. Federal Register API
text: package provides access API United States Federal Register. API provides access Federal Register contents since 1994, including Executive Orders Presidents Clinton, Bush, Obama “Public Inspection” Documents made available prior publication Register. API returns basic details entry Register provides URLs HTML, PDF, plain text versions contents thereof, data fully searchable. federalregister package provides access version 1 API endpoints.

title: Client Package for the U.S. Federal Register API
text: package can installed GitHub:

title: Client Package for the U.S. Federal Register API
text: examples possible uses package.

title: Client Package for the U.S. Federal Register API
text: One cool feature Federal Register API ability retrieve Executive Orders. Constructing necessary API request, example, retrieve Executive Orders 2013 President Obama bit complicated: https://www.federalregister.gov/api/v1/articles.json?conditions%5Bcorrection%5D=0&conditions%5Bpresident%5D=barack-obama&conditions%5Bpresidential_document_type_id%5D=2&conditions%5Bpublication_date%5D%5Byear%5D=2013&conditions%5Btype%5D=PRESDOCU&fields%5B%5D=executive_order_number&fields%5B%5D=title&fields%5B%5D=publication_date&fields%5B%5D=signing_date&fields%5B%5D=citation&fields%5B%5D=document_number&fields%5B%5D=executive_order_notes&fields%5B%5D=html_url&fields%5B%5D=full_text_xml_url&fields%5B%5D=body_html_url&fields%5B%5D=json_url&order=executive_order_number&per_page=1000 using federalregister quite bit easier:
code: library('federalregister') clinton <-  fr_search(presidential_document_type='executive_order',                        president='william-j-clinton', per_page=1000) bush <-     fr_search(presidential_document_type='executive_order',                        president='george-w-bush', per_page=1000) obama <-    fr_search(presidential_document_type='executive_order',                        president='barack-obama', per_page=1000)  # number of Executive Orders c(clint=clinton$count, bush=bush$count, obama=obama$count) clint   bush  obama  968143 968143 968143

title: Client Package for the U.S. Federal Register API
text: Federal Registry entry includes data agency mentions (.e., agencies entry applies ). can use information analyze agencies getting attention, even time.
code: library('federalregister') a <- c('barry-m-goldwater-scholarship-and-excellence-in-education-foundation',        'assassination-records-review-board',        'arctic-research-commission') out <- lapply(a, function(x) fr_search(agencies=x, fields='', per_page=1000)$results) setNames(sapply(out, length), a) barry-m-goldwater-scholarship-and-excellence-in-education-foundation                                                                     0                                    assassination-records-review-board                                                                     0                                            arctic-research-commission                                                                     0

title: Client Package for the U.S. Federal Register API
text: API returns metadata entries Federal Register, including links HTML, PDF, plain text versions entries Federal Register. Using federalregister retrieve plain text URLs, possible reconstruct contents Register use , e.g., kind text mining analysis.
code:
arecord <- fr_get('E9-1719') full <- httr::content(httr::GET(arecord[[1]]$raw_text_url), "text", encoding = "UTF-8") cat(substring(full, 1, 1000)) Federal Register, Volume 74 Issue 15 (Monday, January 26, 2009) 
 [Federal Register Volume 74, Number 15 (Monday, January 26, 2009)] [Presidential Documents] [Pages 4673-4678] From the Federal Register Online via the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov] [FR Doc No: E9-1719]

title: Get Federal Register Metadata — fr_get
text: Function get metadata one Federal Register Documents

title: Get Federal Register Metadata — fr_get
text: docnumber character vector containing one Federal Register document numbers. fields character vector specifying names fields return. See Details. version Federal Register API version. Default 'v1'. ... Additional arguments passed GET.

title: Get Federal Register Metadata — fr_get
text: Allowed values fields : abstract, abstract_html_url, action, agencies, agency_names, body_html_url, cfr_references, citation, comments_close_on, correction_of, corrections, dates, docket_id, docket_ids, document_number, effective_on, end_page, excerpts, executive_order_notes, executive_order_number, full_text_xml_url, html_url, json_url, mods_url, page_length, pdf_url, president, public_inspection_pdf_url, publication_date, raw_text_url, regulation_id_number_info, regulation_id_numbers, regulations_dot_gov_info, regulations_dot_gov_url, significant, signing_date, start_page, subtype, title, toc_doc, toc_subject, topics, type, volume.

title: Search the Federal Register — fr_search
text: Function search entries Federal Register

title: Search the Federal Register — fr_search
code: fr_search(..., fields=NULL, per_page=NULL, page=NULL,            order='relevance', version='v1', getopts = NULL)

title: Search the Federal Register — fr_search
text: ... Named arguments specifying search query. See Details. fields character vector specifying names fields return. See Details. per_page numeric value specifying number records return. Default NULL, returns 20 results per page. Maximum 1000. page numeric value specifying page results return. order character string specifying “relevance” (default), “newest”, “oldest”, “executive_order_number”. version Federal Register API version. Default 'v1'. getopts Additional arguments passed GET.

title: Search the Federal Register — fr_search
text: ... argument contain named arguments together constitute search query. Allowed named arguments : term: character string searched . agencies: character string specifying federal agency mentioned document; multiple agencies arguments can specified one agency named . appropriate character strings agencies arguments can retrieved API Documentation: https://www.federalregister.gov/developers/api/v1. publication_date: list containing named arguments. Allowed values (exact date; date “YYYY-MM-DD” format), year (exact year; year “YYYY” format), gte (greater date; date “YYYY-MM-DD” format), lte (less date; date “YYYY-MM-DD” format). effective_date: list containing named arguments. See publication_date, . type: character string containing “RULE” Final Rule, “PRORULE” Proposed Rule, “NOTICE” Notice, “PRESDOCU” Presidential Document; multiple type arguments can specified one type named . presidential_document_type: character string containing “determination”, “executive_order”, “memorandum”, “notice”, “proclamation”. Multiple presidential_document_type arguments can specified one document type named . president: character string containing name signing President Presidential document types. One “william-j-clinton”, “george-w-bush”, “barack-obama”. Multiple presidential_document_type arguments can specified one president named . docket_id: character string containing agency docket number associated article. regulation_id_number: character string containing Regulation ID Number (RIN) associated article. sections: character string naming section FederalRegister.gov website. Allowed values : “money”, “environment”, “world”, “science--technology”, “business--industry”, “health--public-welfare”. Multiple section arguments can specified one section name named . significant: number 0 “Deemed significant” 1 “deemed significant”, per EO 12866. cfr: list containing named arguments: title, character string containing title Code Federal Regulations , optionally, part, character string specifying part part range (eg '17' '1-50') specified CFR title. near_location: list containing named arguments: location, character string containing zipcode city state within, maximum distance named location miles. Allowed values fields : abstract, abstract_html_url, action, agencies, agency_names, body_html_url, cfr_references, citation, comments_close_on, correction_of, corrections, dates, docket_id, docket_ids, document_number, effective_on, end_page, excerpts, executive_order_notes, executive_order_number, full_text_xml_url, html_url, json_url, mods_url, page_length, pdf_url, president, public_inspection_pdf_url, publication_date, raw_text_url, regulation_id_number_info, regulation_id_numbers, regulations_dot_gov_info, regulations_dot_gov_url, significant, signing_date, start_page, subtype, title, toc_doc, toc_subject, topics, type, volume.

title: Search Public Inspection Documents — pi_search
code: pi_search(..., fields=NULL, per_page=NULL, page=NULL, version='v1', getopts = NULL)

title: Search Public Inspection Documents — pi_search
text: ... Named arguments specifying search query. See Details. fields character vector specifying names fields return. See Details. per_page numeric value specifying number records return. Default NULL, returns 20 results per page. Maximum 1000. page numeric value specifying page results return. version Federal Register API version. Default 'v1'. getopts Additional arguments passed GET.

title: Search Public Inspection Documents — pi_search
text: ... argument contain named arguments together constitute search query. Allowed named arguments : term: character string searched . agencies: character string specifying federal agency mentioned document; multiple agencies arguments can specified one agency named . appropriate character strings agencies arguments can retrieved API Documentation: https://www.federalregister.gov/developers/api/v1. type: character string containing “RULE” Final Rule, “PRORULE” Proposed Rule, “NOTICE” Notice, “PRESDOCU” Presidential Document. Multiple type arguments can specified one type named . special_filing: 0 regular filing 1 special filing. docket_id: agency docket number associated article. Allowed values fields : agencies, docket_numbers, document_number, editorial_note, excerpts, filed_at, filing_type, html_url, json_url, num_pages, pdf_file_size, pdf_updated_at, pdf_url, publication_date, raw_text_url, title, toc_doc, toc_subject, type.
